paper_abstract: In this article, we solve the heat equation with a variable density function. The WKB (Wentzel-Kramers-Brillouin) method is used to find large eigenvalues and the corresponding eigenfunctions. The solution of the heat equation for a non-uniform medium is then presented using an eigenfunction expansion method. (C) 2011 Elsevier Ltd. All rights reserved.
paper_title: On the heat equation with variable properties (applying a WKB method involving turning points)
